author: Times Of India
title: Meenakshi Temple: Meenakshi Temple Offerings Cross 1.1 Crore | Madurai News - Times of India
text: Madurai: The monthly hundial collection at Sri Meenakshi Sundareswarar Temple in Madurai city and its 10 satellite temples crossed 1.1 crore in cash in the past month. It also achieved the 1 crore mark for the second month in a row.In a statement, S Krishnan, joint commissioner/executive officer of the temple, stated that the counting of the hundial collection was carried out on Wednesday in the presence of the temple trustees, officials from the Hindu religious and charitable endowments (HR & CE) department, temple supervisors, bank staff, and temple workers, among others. The total hundial collection amounted to 1,13,92,350 in cash. Further, 397g of gold articles, 548g of silver articles and 253 foreign currency notes were also collected. During the Chithirai festival, the temple hundial collection crossed 1.2 crore.We also published the following articles recentlyDevotees stop demolition of temple in UjjainDistrict administration's road-widening drive in Ujjain's Nayapura area faced resistance from Digambar Jain community over the demolition of the 500-year-old Parshvanath Digambar Jain temple, claimed as a heritage monument.110521411This temple in India is home to 25,000 rats!The Karni Mata Temple in Deshnok, located in Rajasthans Thar Desert, is a unique shrine known for its thousands of holy rats. The temple blurs the line between the divine and earthly, with a rich history dating back to the 14th century.110419908Janhvi Kapoor visits Muppathamman temple in ChennaiBollywood actress Janhvi Kapoor visited Muppathamman temple in Chennai, her late mother's favorite place, with actress Maheswari, ahead of the release of 'Mr And Mrs Mahi' on May 31, 2024.110459096
